data.title: Complete List of Olympic Medalists of Team USA in Shooting and more
data.meta_description: Explore The 2024 Paris Olympics. learn more about the List of Olympic Medalists of Team USA in Shooting. Get more information about the Paris Olympics and much more on Sportskeeda.
data.text:
In the 19th century, as the Industrial Revolution occurred and hunting for food became less necessary for more people, sport shooting evolved and gained popularity. The sport of shooting's governing body is the International Shooting Sport Federation (ISSF), formerly the Lâ€™Union Internationale de Tir (UIT), which was formed in 1907.

The father of the modern Olympic Games, Pierre de Coubertin, was a pistol shooting enthusiast, and so the sport of shooting was one of the first sports to be added to the 1896 Summer Olympics, which were also held in 1900. However, following the latter event, shooting became an inconsistent sport on the Olympic schedule before gaining consistency at the 1932 Summer Olympics.

The men's top medal winners hail from the team events that took place between 1896 and 1924. Five gold medals have been won by six-shooters; out of all of them, Carl Osburn has the most medals earned, 11. American Kim Rhode leads the women's medal table with six medals, including three golds.

Read More : Olympic Torch Relay

The List of Olympic Medalists of Team USA in Shooting

The United States is leading the all-time medal table with a total of 116 medals, including 57 golds, while China is in second place with 67 total medals and 26 golds. The total medal margin of the top countries is 49, which is a huge advantage for the USA in maintaining that lead. Further, the third position is held by the Soviet Union, with a total of 49 medals and 17 golds.
